title.narrative: ADVOCACY & EVIDENCE FOR CSSP

description.narrative: By 2021, government has strengthened awareness and capacity to make decisions for sustainable and inclusive social protection policy awareness and capacity for sustainable and inclusive social protection policies, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Cross sectoral - Operational costs

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, government has strengthened awareness and capacity to make decisions for sustainable and inclusive social protectionpolicy awareness and capacity for sustainable and inclusive social protection policies

description.narrative: UNICEF’s efforts focused on generating the needed evidence to inform the key reforms in policy and operation of the key social protection schemes for children, Child Support Grant and Disability Grant. The landmark diagnostic review of the child sensitive social protection in Thailand provided the evidence base for a concerted advocacy effort to introduce more integration in the social protection system across the contributory and non-contributory child benefits. A dedicated focus on children with disabilities was translated into much needed analysis on the accessibility of the Disability Grant, its relevance and adequacy as well as linkages with other social services. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/01/2022
